definition.name: Codecov
definition.description: GitHub Action that uploads coverage reports for your repository to codecov.io
definition.author: Thomas Hu <@thomasrockhu-codecov> | Codecov

inputs.name: base_sha
inputs.description: The base SHA to select. This is only used in the "pr-base-picking" run command

inputs.name: binary
inputs.description: The file location of a pre-downloaded version of the CLI. If specified, integrity checking will be bypassed.

inputs.name: codecov_yml_path
inputs.description: The location of the codecov.yml file. This is crrently ONLY used for automated test selection (https://docs.codecov.com/docs/getting-started-with-ats). Note that for all other cases, the Codecov yaml will need to be located as described here: https://docs.codecov.com/docs/codecov-yaml#can-i-name-the-file-codecovyml

inputs.name: commit_parent
inputs.description: SHA (with 40 chars) of what should be the parent of this commit.

inputs.name: directory
inputs.description: Folder to search for coverage files. Default to the current working directory

inputs.name: disable_file_fixes
inputs.description: Disable file fixes to ignore common lines from coverage (e.g. blank lines or empty brackets). Read more here https://docs.codecov.com/docs/fixing-reports

inputs.name: disable_search
inputs.description: Disable search for coverage files. This is helpful when specifying what files you want to upload with the files option.

inputs.name: disable_safe_directory
inputs.description: Disable setting safe directory. Set to true to disable.

inputs.name: disable_telem
inputs.description: Disable sending telemetry data to Codecov. Set to true to disable.

inputs.name: dry_run
inputs.description: Don't upload files to Codecov

inputs.name: env_vars
inputs.description: Environment variables to tag the upload with (e.g. PYTHON | OS,PYTHON)

inputs.name: exclude
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of folders to exclude from search.

inputs.name: fail_ci_if_error
inputs.description: On error, exit with non-zero code

inputs.name: files
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of explicit files to upload. These will be added to the coverage files found for upload. If you wish to only upload the specified files, please consider using disable_search to disable uploading other files.

inputs.name: flags
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of flags to upload to group coverage metrics.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: Only used for empty-upload run command

inputs.name: git_service
inputs.description: Override the git_service (e.g. github_enterprise)

inputs.name: gcov_args
inputs.description: Extra arguments to pass to gcov

inputs.name: gcov_executable
inputs.description: gcov executable to run. Defaults to 'gcov'

inputs.name: gcov_ignore
inputs.description: Paths to ignore during gcov gathering

inputs.name: gcov_include
inputs.description: Paths to include during gcov gathering

inputs.name: handle_no_reports_found
inputs.description: If no coverage reports are found, do not raise an exception.

inputs.name: name
inputs.description: Custom defined name of the upload. Visible in the Codecov UI

inputs.name: network_filter
inputs.description: Specify a filter on the files listed in the network section of the Codecov report. This will only add files whose path begin with the specified filter. Useful for upload-specific path fixing.

inputs.name: network_prefix
inputs.description: Specify a prefix on files listed in the network section of the Codecov report. Useful to help resolve path fixing.

inputs.name: os
inputs.description: Override the assumed OS. Options available at cli.codecov.io

inputs.name: override_branch
inputs.description: Specify the branch to be displayed with this commit on Codecov

inputs.name: override_build
inputs.description: Specify the build number manually

inputs.name: override_build_url
inputs.description: The URL of the build where this is running

inputs.name: override_commit
inputs.description: Commit SHA (with 40 chars)

inputs.name: override_pr
inputs.description: Specify the pull request number manually. Used to override pre-existing CI environment variables.

inputs.name: plugins
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of plugins to run. Specify `noop` to turn off all plugins

inputs.name: recurse_submodules
inputs.description: Whether to enumerate files inside of submodules for path-fixing purposes. Off by default.

inputs.name: report_code
inputs.description: The code of the report if using local upload. If unsure, leave default. Read more here https://docs.codecov.com/docs/the-codecov-cli#how-to-use-local-upload

inputs.name: report_type
inputs.description: The type of file to upload, coverage by default. Possible values are "test_results", "coverage".

inputs.name: root_dir
inputs.description: Root folder from which to consider paths on the network section. Defaults to current working directory.

inputs.name: run_command
inputs.description: Choose which CLI command to run. Options are "upload-coverage", "empty-upload", "pr-base-picking", "send-notifications". "upload-coverage" is run by default.

inputs.name: skip_validation
inputs.description: Skip integrity checking of the CLI. This is NOT recommended.

inputs.name: slug
inputs.description: [Required when using the org token] Set to the owner/repo slug used instead of the private repo token. Only applicable to some Enterprise users.

inputs.name: swift_project
inputs.description: Specify the swift project name. Useful for optimization.

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: Repository Codecov token. Used to authorize report uploads

inputs.name: url
inputs.description: Set to the Codecov instance URl. Used by Dedicated Enterprise Cloud customers.

inputs.name: use_legacy_upload_endpoint
inputs.description: Use the legacy upload endpoint.

inputs.name: use_oidc
inputs.description: Use OIDC instead of token. This will ignore any token supplied

inputs.name: use_pypi
inputs.description: Use the pypi version of the CLI instead of from cli.codecov.io

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.description: Enable verbose logging

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: Which version of the Codecov CLI to use (defaults to 'latest')

inputs.name: working-directory
inputs.description: Directory in which to execute codecov.sh
